intro: Lychnis helvetica, commonly known as the Swiss pink, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its clustered, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and features linear, slightly hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Lychnis helvetica is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
